basic_data.name: 1926 Le Soleil Hotel & Spa
basic_data.priceRange: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

address.streetAddress: Thornton Street Intersection with Hughes Hallet Street

description: Inspired by the life and passions of one man and featuring a touch of the roaring twenties, 1926 Le Soleil Hotel & Spa offers luxurious rooms and suites in the central city of Sliema. The hotel is located 200 meters from the seafront and also offers a splendid 1926 La Plage Beach Club on the water’s edge as well as a luxury SPA. The beach club is located 200 meters away from the hotel and is a seasonal operation. Our concept of ‘Lean Luxury’ includes the following: • Luxury rooms at affordable prices • Uncomplicated comfort and a great sleep • Smart design technology • Raindance showerheads • Flat screens • SuitePad Tablets • Self check in and check out (if desired) • Coffee & tea making facilities
featues: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!
reviews.text: Hotel was amazing! Couldnt have asked for a better getaway especially during Winter! Shoutout to Lily for always helping and also the entire restaurant/bar group of staff (i mean every single one of them!). They were ALL so welcoming and attentive with smiles on their faces at all times! Upon arrival we were given the choice of Mulled Wine or Orange Infused Water - a nice touch!  Spa: Spa was open from 9am - 9pm i believe and no slot booking was required! Spa pool is heated and has jets. There is a sauna and steam room and 2 heated loungers you can lay on. Heated loungers also had cleaning spray next to them so you could wipe down the loungers before laying on them. Robes and slippers are provided in your rooms - can use to go to spa in. reviews.title: Special Place to Getaway from UK Winter
reviews.text: For the time of year and price reflective of this I thought it was 5/5 lovely stylish hotel lobby with tall Christmas tree, piano and g/father clock and searing area. Check in was welcoming and helpful as arrived early and luggage was looked after while we all had a look around Sliema, hotel very close to waterfront restaurants and shops. The rooms on 3rd floor were clean and comfortable, balcony was looking to side street we didn't utilise as went out and about every day. Switch besides bed for do not disturb or make-up my room signs outside and code for door I thought were brilliant. Housekeeping team great. Thanks Maricel. Kind helpful receptionists Lily and Abelmy.  Food good at breakfast with additions like chia pudding, overnight oats, fresh fruits, salad, eggs, cereal,

reviews.title: Poor Experience - There are better choices in Malta!!
reviews.text: This hotel left much to be desired. Throughout my stay, the service quality was consistently disappointing. From check-in to check-out, the experience was subpar. I wouldn’t recommend it, particularly for solo travelers, as it seemed poorly managed and gave off the impression of taking advantage of tourists. Issues ranged from inefficient processes to lackluster customer support. Overall, a regrettable choice for accommodation

reviews.title: FANTASTIC hotel - would definitely recommend
reviews.text: This hotel was fantastic. We had a city facing room, which was modern, spacious and clean. The room has a small balcony which has 2 chairs. The bathroom is very clean as well. We had breakfast included which was definitely worth it. The beach club was open for 2 of the days during our stay and it had a great atmosphere and picturesque view.. The spa was amazing as well. Would definitely recommend and we will be back. The location is great - walking distance from shops, the bus route, the sliema ferry terminal and many restaurants.

reviews.title: Classy hotel with great staff
reviews.text: Really lovely hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. We had a suite with a great view of the sea. Everything is done with class, from the foyer to the bar and restaurant. Prosecco at check in is a nice touch. Breakfast buffet very good, though could do more veggie options. The spa pool and sauna is a very relaxing space.  The hotel has a separate area on the sea front with a pool, bar and restaurant, which is great though it closed abruptly midweek while we were there. They also put on a free tour to Mdina in a vintage bus, which was great and a nice touch.  Sliema is very built up but there's a lovely promenade walk and you're never far from restaurants and shops. There's a quick ferry to Valetta, which is definitely worth a visit.   Really nice stay, and again, the staff

reviews.title: Hotel way overrated and not worth the money
reviews.text: We choose this hotel because of the good reviews and nice pictures.  But the reality is all different and we were disappointed.  Definitely not worth the price we paid. Already upon arrival, the check-in procedure is complicated!  There are 3 persons at the desk, but you have to download an app on your phone and register online.  So stupid, as they had to help us with that as it didn't work on my iPhone.  We had a standard room, with a "great" view on the interior court and were basically nose to nose to the building in front of us.   The room was very dark, and without any sunlight. When you sat on the balcony, you were just above the breakfast tables! Early morning you can hear the people at breakfast moving around chairs, talk, etc.  Not suited for people who want to sleep.

reviews.title: Vacation
reviews.text: Great hotel with an amazing service. Spa is really nice if you want to relax. Big thanks to girls from reception, Giorgia and Lily, they have been amazing and so helpful. Staff at the restaurant and bar is really nice and polite. Good breakfast and clean rooms. Sale manager Sarka was really helpful answering all our questions before booking hotel.

reviews.title: Awesome hotel with great facilities and location
reviews.text: We absolutely loved hotel 1926 Le Soleil, great location in Sliema. Breakfast was excellent, including full English or Continental, you can even have a glass of Prosecco with your breakfast.   The rooms are a little small, but big enough. The beds were comfortable and they have a nice shower. Complementary Nespresso capsules, tea and coffee.  But the standout feature is the App that they have developed. You can make requests or ask questions while you’re out and about and the staff are very responsive.  I highly recommend the hotel

reviews.title: Good hotel
reviews.text: We had booked to stay for a week, but sadly had to cut our stay short, due to an injury ( which happened on a bus, driven violently and erratically.) this hotel is kept spotlessly clean in all areas. We stayed in room 901 ( I think). This was a spacious, bright and airy room, wih a partial sea view. Be aware that the hotel is situated in quite a narrow street, amid appartment buildings of several storeys. This means that if you’re staying on lower floors, it’s likely that your room will be darker, with obscured views, so ask for a high floor. We had a good balcony, too, which was relaxing. Furnishings are minimal, but sufficient, with open hanging space  and no drawers. We don’t pack light and managed ok. The bed and pillows were very confortable, bed linen was fresh. Plenty of

reviews.title: Almost Made it to 5 Stars!
reviews.text: Upon arrival, check-in was nice with a complimentary glass of prosecco. Our room was one of the basic rooms with a view of the buildings across the road.  The bathroom was lovely and the amenities such as tea/coffee in the room were good.   The room was cleaned daily and tea/coffee was stocked up. This was a birthday trip and after a slight mishap with the 'birthday set-up' in the room, the issue was resolved by hotel staff. Hotel breakfast was not the best, it tasted quite cheap for 15Euro pp.  The hotel bar wasn't the best as they didn't have ingredients for any of the cocktails that were requested from the menu! reviews.title: Good hotel, good staff, good service, good location!
Great boutique hotel in a fantastic central location
Enjoyed it so much we booked another two stays!
Fantastic quality for minimal money (at least in winter).
Excellent location to explore Valletta from Sliema but dirty and overcrowded pool ( no priority given to guests)
Nice modern hotel
reviews.text: I had a room on my own which was clean and comfortable..no view of any great sorts from the balcony but i think because its in a side street you're not really going to sit out there when the beach is not far away at all. The hotel is modern and the breakfast very good. The staff were all friendly and helpful and the indoor pool area looked lovely. I did have a prob one night when my key code did not work but the girl came to my rescue followed by a male member of staff who sorted it all. A little local shop a stones throw away to buy water at a reasonable price  with a friendly local man in, the hotel did provide water free from the maid but you have to pay if you want it from reception.., its not far from the town, beach and eateries etc..i thought it may be noisy where it was

reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.text: Took my mother here for her 60th birthday and I’m soooo happy I booked this hotel, it was amazing, would 100% book it again and recommend to friends. The hotel itself was so relaxing, well decorated and had everything you would need, the rooms were gorgeous, the spa was so relaxing and the treatments available made it hard to choose. The hotel put in a complimentary trip (a vintage bus tour) which was so good, cannot believe it was free, they took us out for 4 hours to three different locations. It was such a nice touch, they also had other things on like yoga on the roof terrace on another day. The pool / bar was literally 5 mins away and it was so nice and peaceful. 100% would recommend to couples, girls trips or even families as the hotels it perfectly located.

reviews.title: Honeymoon bliss
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week in September on our honeymoon. 10/10 it was fantastic. Hotel was beautiful, staff were super friendly especially those during breakfast time. Bedrooms were spotless and a lovely surprise for us when we checked into our room. The spa facilities were very relaxing and the massage was fantastic.  The pool then was a very short walk from the hotel, absolutely bliss. Would come back again in a heartbeat. Would recommend to couples who want to chill and relax or go and explore. Great location. Plenty of public transport around area, and great places to eat and drink. Keep up the great work!

reviews.title: Highly recommend
reviews.text: Really lovely hotel with great facilities. We really enjoyed the spa and also going down to the beach pool area for a swim and sunbathe, such a great view. We had a lovely lunch and a few cocktails at the bar down there. Staff in the hotel were always very friendly and helpful.  The hotel was in a great location too. Easy access to both bus  tours and boat trips so an excellent base for exploring the island. Huge choice of bars and restaurants too locally to choose from.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: Lovely hotel tucked away on a side street but with easy access to the beach and beach club, less than a five-minute walk away. The staff are super friendly and approachable; nothing is too much trouble. Offered Prosecco and non-alcoholic refreshments at check-in, which are welcome after a journey or early start. The rooms are clean and functional. We were in a family room with a double sofa bed and one double bed, both comfortable enough for sound sleep. The balcony is small and has a bistro table and two chairs, but you wouldn't sit there for very long as it overlooks the street, at the most, for a quick coffee or drink, but not somewhere where you would linger/relax. reviews.title: Amazing hotel and staff!!
reviews.text: Myself and my partner had THE best stay at the 1926 hotel, I can’t thank the staff enough for how enjoyable our first trip to Malta was!  The hotel is in a quiet area away from the main road in sliema which is why we booked it, it’s a lovely hidden gem!  From check in the staff were incredibly friendly, very informative and couldn’t do enough for us. They had a live pianist playing when we arrived which was so lovely and the hotel itself is lovely and modern.  Prior to our stay I had contacted the hotel in regard to organising the room for my partners birthday in which they had fulfilled my request which was a lovely surprise for my partner when we first entered the room. reviews.title: Sliema visit
reviews.text: Great location, very clean & comfortable. Amazing staff; friendly, efficient & couldn’t do enough for us.  Breakfast buffet always well stocked with tasty range of food. Rooms very clean, comfy bed (if you like firm), but lacking draws / storage space for clothes. Complimentary vintage bus tour was really special.

reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.text: A fabulous stay from start to finish. Super hospitality, prosecco on arrival, great spa facilities and beach club. The location is great, 2 mins walk to the sea front and a choice of restaurants, 5 mins walk to Sliema main town with lots of trips, restaurants and the ferry to Valetta. About 20-30mins walk to beautiful St Julian.  We managed to book onto the complimentary vintage bus tour which is a must if you are able to. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.title: Fab hotel
reviews.text: What a beautiful hotel , with staff to match, nothing too much trouble. Great location, just a short walk to the sea and infinity pool . Beautiful views of Malta from our 11 th floor room  Perfect stay .

reviews.title: Amazing experience
reviews.text: It's my first time here in Malta and also in Radisson Blu St. Julian's and I was amazed with their incomparable hospitality service. All the staff were very good and very helpful, especially to Ronald at the concierge and Donna at the Bistro. I hope to come back here again in the near future. Thank you to all.
